newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Geneva Sept air cargo declines 9.7 pct.
newsitem.headline: Geneva Sept air cargo declines 9.7 pct.

text.p: Geneva's Cointrin airport handled 5,093 tonnes of air cargo traffic in September, a decline of 9.8 percent on the same 1995 month, airport authority figures show.
January-September 1996 air cargo throughput at Geneva totalled 47,801 tonnes, down 6.7 percent on 1995 levels.
At end-October, Swissair introduced a twice-weekly full-freighter service between Geneva and Singapore using a 67-tonne capacity McDonnell Douglas DC10-30F aircraft.
Geneva replaced Basle on the Swiss airline's weekly DC10-30F service to Sao Paulo, also from the end of last month.

September 1996 postal traffic handled at the airport decreased by 14.5 percent on the same month last year to 695 tonnes, while January-September volume fell by 2.3 percent on the first nine months of 1995 to 6,426 tonnes. --Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542 7706 Fax +44 171 542 5017
